meanings.definition: In a way that is not believable or realistic.
meanings.sent1: The magician made the rabbit disappear implausibly quickly.
meanings.sent2: The idea of a talking dog is implausibly strange.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried implausibly to convince the fish to come out of the bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her excuse for being late was implausibly creative.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship traveled implausibly fast through the galaxy.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is unlikely to happen.
meanings.sent1: She implausibly won the lottery twice in a row.
meanings.sent2: It is implausibly rare to find a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried implausibly to fly with the seagulls.
meanings.sent4: His dream of becoming a superhero seemed implausibly distant.
meanings.sent5: The chances of winning the jackpot are implausibly slim.
